rev.comment: Use actual logo fro the rivalry; team logos had no rationales for use anyway

Line 11: Line 11:
==History==
==History==
â
[[image:Route1RivalryFSC logo-3Dlg.jpg|250px|right]]
 
For years, one of the most controversial aspects of both the [[University of Delaware]] and [[Delaware State University]] football programs was the fact that they had never been scheduled as potential instate rivals for a regular season game. It is highly unusual for two state universities, that play on the same athletic tier, to not play one another, especially one that is less than one hour's drive away from the others campus. Critics charged that this had to do with the fact that DSU is a [[Historically Black College]]. Furthermore, supporters of a game between DSU and UD claimed that it would be akin to other instate rivalries and would be good for the state. In 2007, Jeff Pearlman, a University of Delaware graduate and [[ESPN]] writer, wrote a scathing article charging the Blue Hens with racism.<ref>{{cite news|last=Jeff |first=By |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?page=pearlman/070920 |title=ESPN Page 2 - Pearlman: Yellow Blue Hens |publisher=Sports.espn.go.com |date=September 24, 2007 |accessdate=2008-12-08}}</ref> In response to the charges of racism on UD's part, their supporters pointed out that Delaware has scheduled and played regular season games against several other HBCUs such as [[Morgan State University|Morgan State]] and [[North Carolina A&T]]. UD supporters also claimed that DSU's team was not as strong as the Blue Hens, and that UD's program had made commitments to other universities that they had to fulfill. Finally, UD supporters also noted the fact that the two colleges routinely meet in other sports than football.
For years, one of the most controversial aspects of both the [[University of Delaware]] and [[Delaware State University]] football programs was the fact that they had never been scheduled as potential instate rivals for a regular season game. It is highly unusual for two state universities, that play on the same athletic tier, to not play one another, especially one that is less than one hour's drive away from the others campus. Critics charged that this had to do with the fact that DSU is a [[Historically Black College]]. Furthermore, supporters of a game between DSU and UD claimed that it would be akin to other instate rivalries and would be good for the state. In 2007, Jeff Pearlman, a University of Delaware graduate and [[ESPN]] writer, wrote a scathing article charging the Blue Hens with racism.<ref>{{cite news|last=Jeff |first=By |url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/page2/story?page=pearlman/070920 |title=ESPN Page 2 - Pearlman: Yellow Blue Hens |publisher=Sports.espn.go.com |date=September 24, 2007 |accessdate=2008-12-08}}</ref> In response to the charges of racism on UD's part, their supporters pointed out that Delaware has scheduled and played regular season games against several other HBCUs such as [[Morgan State University|Morgan State]] and [[North Carolina A&T]]. UD supporters also claimed that DSU's team was not as strong as the Blue Hens, and that UD's program had made commitments to other universities that they had to fulfill. Finally, UD supporters also noted the fact that the two colleges routinely meet in other sports than football.
